poem:
### Defiant in Kupiansk

On tank-beaten roads,
a bicycle whispers through.
Among ruins, he rides—
worldly goods clinging close,
a symbol of daily defiance.
Burned-out shells gleam silent,
yet life cycles on,
undaunted by the weight
of war's obscene scar.
A man,
and his perseverance,
refuse to crumble.
